And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;

verses.text: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

similars.text: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

verses.text: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:
Who shall also confirm you unto the end, that ye may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

similars.text: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.

I say unto you, that I know of myself that whatsoever I shall say unto you, concerning that which is to come, is true; and I say unto you, that I know that Jesus Christ shall come, yea, the Son, the Only Begotten of the Father, full of grace, and mercy, and truth. And behold, it is he that cometh to take away the sins of the world, yea, the sins of every man who steadfastly believeth on his name.
To the end he may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all his saints.
That thou keep this commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:

verses.text: God is faithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

similars.text: That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.

Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:
For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.

verses.text: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you; but that ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.

similars.text: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,
Hearken, O ye elders of my church whom I have called, behold I give unto you a commandment, that ye shall assemble yourselves together to agree upon my word;

And now, my beloved brethren, and also Jew, and all ye ends of the earth, hearken unto these words and believe in Christ; and if ye believe not in these words believe in Christ. And if ye shall believe in Christ ye will believe in these words, for they are the words of Christ, and he hath given them unto me; and they teach all men that they should do good.
In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,

And now, my brethren, seeing that ye know the light by which ye may judge, which light is the light of Christ, see that ye do not judge wrongfully; for with that same judgment which ye judge ye shall also be judged.
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

And these are the words which he spake and caused to be written, saying: My brethren, all ye that have assembled yourselves together, you that can hear my words which I shall speak unto you this day; for I have not commanded you to come up hither to trifle with the words which I shall speak, but that you should hearken unto me, and open your ears that ye may hear, and your hearts that ye may understand, and your minds that the mysteries of God may be unfolded to your view.
How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.
Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ's sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,

verses.text: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by them which are of the house of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.

similars.text: For verily, verily I say unto you, he that hath the spirit of contention is not of me, but is of the devil, who is the father of contention, and he stirreth up the hearts of men to contend with anger, one with another.

verses.text: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.

similars.text: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

For these are they who are of Paul, and of Apollos, and of Cephas.
For these are they who are of Paul, and of Apollos, and of Cephas.
For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

verses.text: Is Christ divided? was Paul crucified for you? or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?
I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;
Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.

similars.text: And they are they who are ordained of me to baptize in my name, according to that which is written;

I am the same which have taken the Zion of Enoch into mine own bosom; and verily, I say, even as many as have believed in my name, for I am Christ, and in mine own name, by the virtue of the blood which I have spilt, have I pleaded before the Father for them.

verses.text: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.
For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.
For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

similars.text: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.

verses.text: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

similars.text: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

Therefore, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, yea, a marvelous work and a wonder, for the wisdom of their wise and learned shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent shall be hid.

Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.

verses.text: Where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the disputer of this world? hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?

similars.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

verses.text: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.

similars.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! When they are learned they think they are wise, and they hearken not unto the counsel of God, for they set it aside, supposing they know of themselves, wherefore, their wisdom is foolishness and it profiteth them not. And they shall perish.
But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;
For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.
Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

verses.text: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:
But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;

similars.text: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

verses.text: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.
Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.

similars.text: That your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.
For, behold, you should not have feared man more than God. Although men set at naught the counsels of God, and despise his words--

similars.text: But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;

verses.text: That no flesh should glory in his presence.

verses.text: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:
